content: Do we have a page that explains the effects of declaring instance has_coe*? I see at least has_coe, has_coe_t, has_lift, has_coe_to_fun and has_coe_to_sort. I understand that the last two are for coercion to Sort* and Π _, _, respectively. Do I understand correctly that after has_lift (finset α) (set α) I need to explicitly write (↑s : set α), and the difference between has_coe and has_coe_t is that the latter is not used by composition instances?
IIRC has_coe_t can only be the last step in a chain. (Don't know if it's intended but I remember it as t for "tail". Compare https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/blob/master/src/Init/Coe.lean)
Thank you. I probably skipped this when I first read TPIL.
